adjective.description: Explained by Carroll as: grave, solemn. (Only in Carroll and later allusions.).

origin: Mid 16th century. Origin unknown; perhaps related to mum, although this would present phonological difficulties. Apparently not related to French môme little child<br>mid 19th century; earliest use found in Lewis Carroll (1832–1898), author, mathematician, and photographer (real name Charles Lutwidge Dodgson). A factitious word introduced by Lewis Carroll.
